title: Implement dynamic GST rate table with auto-updates for all supported provinces
summary: Design and deliver a robust GST rate management framework that supports all Canadian provinces, enabling ongoing updates to GST rates as they change at the federal and provincial levels. The solution must actively reflect and enforce new rates across the entire B2B SaaS platform. It should integrate automated update mechanisms to minimize manual intervention and ensure tax accuracy.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: dynamically manage provincial tax rates (including dual-tax provinces), update with government changes

low_confidence_reason: automation inferred due to focus on automated updates.

title: Develop dual-GST province logic for correct allocation and calculation
summary: Establish logic within the system to accurately allocate and calculate GST for provinces operating under dual-GST regimes such as Quebec, ensuring compliance with the specific rules of each affected jurisdiction. This function must clearly distinguish which GST components apply and ensure allocations are compliant with local regulations.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: manage provincial tax rates (including dual-tax provinces)

title: Apply province-correct GST rates during invoice generation based on billing address, service location, and exemptions
summary: Implement a process in invoice generation to apply the correct GST rates determined by the customer's billing address, service location, and any applicable tax exemptions. This ensures that GST calculations are accurate for every scenario, reducing risk of misapplied tax and supporting regulatory compliance.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: GST application is required for each invoice based on billing address, service location, and exemptions

title: Display GST breakdown (federal/provincial) on all invoices
summary: Ensure that generated invoices clearly present a breakdown of GST charges, distinguishing between federal and provincial tax amounts. This supports customer transparency, regulatory accountability, and enables clients to comply with internal accounting standards.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: line-item breakdowns for federal and provincial portions

low_confidence_reason: transparency inferred from intent to clarify line-item tax breakdowns.

title: Support multi-rate invoices for split shipments or services
summary: Extend invoice and billing logic to handle multiple GST rates in a single invoice, which may arise when shipments or services span multiple tax jurisdictions within the same transaction. The system should accurately segment and calculate GST per applicable region.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: support multi-rate invoices for split shipments or services

title: Enable customer-level tax exemption with validation and documentation capture
summary: Build features that permit certain customers to claim GST exemption, provided valid documentation is supplied and verified. The system should track exemption records and maintain auditable evidence to ensure ongoing compliance and defensibility in audits.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: handle edge cases like tax exemptions, and maintain audit logs

low_confidence_reason: compliance inferred since documentation and auditability are referenced.

title: Handle retroactive GST rate changes and notify affected customers
summary: Ensure the GST module can apply and record retroactive rate adjustments, and proactively notify any customers impacted by such changes. This includes maintaining historical tax rates and utilizing them for correct financial record-keeping.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: handle retroactive rate adjustments and maintain audit logs

title: Apply fallback GST rules for ambiguous or missing address data and flag for review
summary: Implement fallback rules to determine provisional GST rates when address data is incomplete or ambiguous, and flag such transactions for manual review. This helps maintain tax integrity and reduces risk posed by data errors or incomplete customer records.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: handle ambiguous addresses ... and flag for review

title: Log all tax rate changes, overrides, and manual adjustments with user metadata
summary: The module must maintain comprehensive logs for all GST rate changes—automatic or manual—including overrides and user-triggered adjustments. Audit trails should include user metadata to ensure traceability, supporting both compliance and internal controls.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: maintain audit logs ... with user metadata; ...reconciliation tools

low_confidence_reason: compliance inferred due to requirement for regulatory audit logs.

title: Integrate with government tax rate APIs for automatic updates
summary: Develop integration connectors with official government APIs to automatically fetch and apply updated GST rates. This helps the system remain current and compliant with regulatory changes without introducing operational lag or manual intervention.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: integration with tax rate APIs and coordination ... Deliverables: ... tax rate management UI

low_confidence_reason: automation inferred based on automated updates via API.

title: Generate GST summary reports per province supporting accrual and cash methods
summary: Develop reporting functionality to generate GST summary reports for each Canadian province. Reports must be capable of supporting both accrual and cash accounting methods, reflecting dynamic provincial tax rate configurations. Ensures provincial compliance and provides actionable insights for finance teams.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Reporting must support province-level GST summaries, both accrual and cash accounting, exportable audit-ready data.

title: Provide audit-ready exports and reconciliation tools for finance and compliance
summary: Implement tools to export audit-ready GST and financial data, facilitating reconciliation for finance teams and ensuring regulatory compliance. The exports must be formatted for audit processes and support robust review by compliance teams.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Reporting must support province-level GST summaries, both accrual and cash accounting, exportable audit-ready data, and reconciliation tools.

title: Upgrade self-service portal for GST-compliant invoice and tax summary downloads
summary: Enhance the self-service portal to allow users to download GST-compliant invoices and tax summaries. Upgrades must ensure that downloaded documents reflect current provincial GST rules and support user-friendly access to tax breakdowns.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Accurate GST application is required for each invoice based on billing address, service location, and exemptions, with line-item breakdowns for federal and provincial portions.
